name: Monks' Walk from Brimham Rocks to Fountains Abbey

ai.summary: A strenuous 18.7 km hike linking Brimham Rocks to Fountains Abbey in North Yorkshire, England. The route combines dramatic limestone landscapes, woodland trails, and historic sites, with long ascents and exposed sections typical of a hard day on the North Yorkshire countryside.
ai.terrain_summary: Rugged, uneven trails over limestone moorland and valley floors. Expect steep climbs, loose stones, grassy paths, and occasional paddocks and gates. Some sections near Brimham Rocks feature rocky outcrops and narrow paths; navigation relies on waymarked routes in parts of the route.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long day with variable weather. Wear sturdy boots and layers, and carry a map or GPS. Bring sufficient water and snacks, and be prepared for boggy sections after rain. Stay on waymarked paths where possible, watch for livestock and gates, and be mindful of shorter daylight hours in winter.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (March–October) is ideal; winter hiking is possible with extra precautions and shorter daylight hours.

seo.title: Monks' Walk: Brimham Rocks to Fountains Abbey – 18.7 km Hard Hike in North Yorkshire, UK
seo.meta_description: Tackle the challenging 18.7 km Monks' Walk from Brimham Rocks to Fountains Abbey in North Yorkshire, UK. Enjoy rugged limestone landscapes, dramatic rock formations, and historic abbey scenery.
